definition: to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
see 考試卷|考试卷[kao3 shi4 juan4]

sentences.english: We handed in our exams at the last minute of the class.
sentences.chinese: 在下課的最後時刻，我們交了考試卷。

sentences.english: We will give you the question paper.
You'd better look through your examination papers before you hand then in.
sentences.chinese: 在你交上考試卷之前仔細檢查以下。

sentences.english: The teacher gave out the examination papers.
I marked the students' quiz papers.
sentences.chinese: 我批改了學生們的小考試卷。

sentences.english: Having picked up the examination papers, the teacher announced the class dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 在收完了所有的考試卷之後，老師宣佈放學。

sentences.english: He is answering the test paper busily.
I have to grade all these tests.
sentences.chinese: 我須要給所有這些考試卷打分數。

sentences.english: After all, most students have been faced with the temptation to peek at a neighbor's test paper.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，最多的學生已經面對窺視鄰近考試卷的誘惑。
